channel.title: Gens on clipperhouse.com
channel.description: Recent content in Gens on clipperhouse.com

item.title: gen: Type-driven code generation for Go
item.description: gen is an attempt to bring some generics-like functionality to Go. It uses type annotations to add “of T” functionality to your packages.

item.title: gen: TypeWriters
item.description: gen is driven by “type writers” – packages which are responsible for interpreting the annotated tags and turning them into generated code.

item.title: gen: force flag
item.description: Tolerating type errors gen operates by parsing and type-checking your source code. The correctness of your code will affect gen’s ability to operate.

item.title: gen: optional typewriters
item.description: Here are a few optional typewriters I’ve created. They are not built into gen, but can be added as follows.

item.title: gen: slice typewriter
item.description: The slice typewriter is built into gen by default. It generates functional convenience methods that will look familiar to users of C#’s LINQ or JavaScript’s Array methods.

item.title: gen: stringer
item.description: The stringer typewriter is a fork of Rob Pikeâ€™s tool of the same name, which generates readable strings for consts.
